bibl.title: A Ptolemaic Inscription from Bir 'Iayyan.
bibl.note: 1. Bir 'Iayyan [on the Edfu-Barramiya road ca 97 km east of Edfu]. - 2. The Inscription [a distance marker from the Nile, set up by the "toparch of the three" Rhodon son of Lysimachos, 22 August-20 September 257 B.C.]. - 3. The Administration of Upper Egypt. - 4. Fragments of An Inscription [found close to the other].
bibl.seg: BAGNALL Roger S., Joseph G. MANNING, Steven E. SIDEBOTHAM and Ronald E. ZITTERKOPF, A Ptolemaic Inscription from Bir 'Iayyan.

1. Bir 'Iayyan [on the Edfu-Barramiya road ca 97 km east of Edfu]. - 2. The Inscription [a distance marker from the Nile, set up by the "toparch of the three" Rhodon son of Lysimachos, 22 August-20 September 257 B.C.]. - 3. The Administration of Upper Egypt. - 4. Fragments of An Inscription [found close to the other].
